title: Do You Really Need to Get Weighed at the Doctor? Some Doctors Say No
sub_head: More doctors are de-emphasizing weigh-ins or are trying to make stepping on the scale less stressful
body:
The obligatory stepping on the scale is a dreaded part of doctor visits for many patients. Now, some doctors are letting people opt out of weigh-ins.
More doctors are de-emphasizing weight as a barometer of health as patients in recent years have lobbied to reduce focus on weight. Health professionals say they are trying to avoid stigmatizing patients and want to make sure that discomfort with weigh-ins doesnâ€™t dissuade people from coming in.
